Class ReportCard

  • java.lang.Object
    • ReportCard

  • public class ReportCard
extends java.lang.Object
    The purpose of the ReportCard class is to track the performance of a player during a gameplay session. It is a ledger that catalogues the number of professors hit, the number of deans hit, the number of sorority girls hit, the number of ruler swings, the number of hammer swings, the number of F minuses received, and the number of broken hearts (the penalty for hitting a sorority girl, which is not yet implemented). From these basic recordings, other data such as swing accuracy can be computed. Such information is retrievable by calling the methods of this class.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ReportCard()
      Sets every metric that this ReportCard records to 0.

        Returns:
        returns the total number of broken hearts received.

      • getNumberOfMalletSwings

        public int getNumberOfMalletSwings()
        Returns:
        returns the sum total number of mallet swings, both ruler and hammer swings are included in the total.

      • getNumberOfMoleHits

        public int getNumberOfMoleHits()
        Returns:
        returns the sum total number of moles hit, including deans and professors.

      • getNumberOfMisses

        public int getNumberOfMisses()
        Returns:
        returns the total number of mallet swings that didn't hit a mole.

      • getNumberOfBadHits

        public int getNumberOfBadHits()
        Returns:
        returns the sum total number of incorrect hits, both f minuses and broken hearts are included in the total.

      • getAccuracy

        public double getAccuracy()
        Returns:
        returns the swing accuracy which is the ratio of moles hit to mallet swings.

      • getAmountOfExtraTimeEarned

        public int getAmountOfExtraTimeEarned()
        Returns:
        returns the total number seconds added to the clock.

      • calculateGrade

        public java.lang.String calculateGrade(int score)
        This class grades the player's performance. If the player is less than 500 they will get an F. Increasing in 500 point increments, the grade increases as follows: F,D,D+,C,C+,B,B+,A-,A,A+
        Parameters:
        score - the final score the player received during a play session
        Returns:
        returns the grade the student received based on his score.
